docs.title: Me
docs.text:
This is Shakib, along with software development and operation, I have been an education mentor since 2020, teaching, training and mentoring junior developers, linux admins as well as English classes to boost their ESL skills.

So if you are working in IT and Software Development industry you have come to the very right place, I am doing what you are doing; coding, debugging, etc

docs.title: You
docs.text: Have you ever been in a class that your teacher was reading a story, or a grammar book to you? We are not going to do this. We do not waste your time reading a book in our classes. We totally focus on what maters the most and covers your need.

docs.title: Why most speaking classes suck
docs.text:
If you have seen yourself in these conditions and situations then the classes you have for speaking are not going to help you really :|

  • the teacher is reading from a text book
  • the teacher is reading grammar book to you
  • the teacher is reading words/terms form a book
  • the teacher plays some video/audio files in the classes and you are listing
  • the teacher did not have a roadmap for you
  • the teacher does not allow you recording your classes

Warning

Any of above sings show ineffectiveness in your speaking class. Any of non-speaking activities relevant to speaking should be done outside of the classes and in the class time your total focus should be on speaking and listing.

docs.title: Meeting
docs.text:
Online classes and meetings can be held on

  • Google Meet
  • Skype
  • Microsoft Team

Mostly all meetings are held on Google Meet.

The Link for Google Meet is

https://meet.google.com/xnn-vxpc-nmh

Tip

You can also use https://meet.shakiba.net as an alias Opening https://meet.shakiba.net in your web browser leads you to Google Meet page as well.

Note

You can bookmark the Google Meet link, it is a permanent link and does not change

The link for Skype

https://web.skype.com

Warning

web.skype.com and Skype services have been deprecated by MS and the alternative one is MS-Team

For Microsoft Team

https://teams.live.com/v2

Note

My username on Skype is shakibamoshiri, and its the same on Microsoft Team

You can access classes resource on class.shakiba.net website. The username and password will be send to you after

  • defining a roadmap for you

The resources content can be accessed by

  • any web browser at class.shakiba.net

  • using iOS app

to login into your account using either Android or iOS, the domain for login is class.shakiba.net

Please let me know if you found any issues

List of useful websites will be added in their relevant categories

Note

If you know any useful ones please kindly inform me to update this document

docs.title: ATS
docs.text:
An ATS (Applicant Tracking System) is used checking a resume if it matches a company expectations. It is always a good idea to test your resume with an ATS before sending it

Note

Do not spend too much time and money on ATS, some just bombarding your with unnecessary comments and tweaks

docs.title: List
docs.text:
• Manatal — SMB-friendly ATS with AI-based features, free trial available
  • Wellfound — Free ATS built for startups hiring tech talent
  • GoHire — Simple ATS with free trial and discounts for startups & charities
  • Teamtailor — Free ATS trial with top-tier employer branding and DEI tools
  • Tellent Recruitee — Collaborative ATS with the option to try free for 18 days
  • Monday.com — Agile project management tool that can flex into free, functional ATS
  • Dover — Among the best free applicant tracking systems for UI UX
  • Loxo — Free applicant tracking system for staffing agencies
  • VanHack — Free job board tailored for global tech organizations
  • Recooty — Affordable ATS with no obligation, 14-day free trial
  • Zoho Recruit — Free ATS and CRM for corporates and staffing agencies
  • MightyRecruiter — Free ATS with unlimited users, job posts, and resume searching

docs.title: Non Technical
docs.text: The HR interview is the most common type of Non-Technical interview and we will cover all type of HRs

docs.title: HR
docs.text:
The HR interview can vary depending on

  • type of a company
  • location of a company (country)
  • type of work (remotely, on-site)
  • etc

Here we cover all sort of HR interviews, including

  • General interview
  • Behavioral interview
  • Cultural-Fit interview
  • Meeting-Team interview (interview with team members)

docs.title: Behavioral
docs.text: The behavioral HR is targeting your behavior in specific condition. The purpose is to know your behavior since they have not been working with you.

docs.title: Cultural-Fit
docs.text: The cultural-fit interview is to ensure your mindset and perspective can get along with the company mindset and perspectives

docs.title: General
docs.text: The general interviews are those are being asked general questions.Mostly are about knowing you.

docs.title: Resume
docs.text: Resume review for minor changes and tweaks are free, for full revision and rewrite, it costs pre that time allocated for. See the Bill tab for more details

docs.title: Schedule
docs.text: Here you will find how classes are scheduled

docs.title: procedure
docs.text:
The procedure of having a class

  • booking a test session
  • passing test interview
  • exploring your needs, goals, targets to define a roadmap
  • finding the best time suited for you
  • starting classes as we planed

Info

If one found a need to change the classes time, after two weeks we will set a new time slot

Info

Every two weeks we will have a feedback session reviewing your

  • performance
  • improvement
  • concerns
  • etc

This session is an optional one and free

docs.title: Book
docs.text:
Here you will find how to book a class/meeting

Note

Students should book on weekends for one to two in advanced, new comers allowed to book only one session in this period

Warning

Canceling an appointment is allowed and costs you 30% of a single session payment, for example if a session was $10, if you cancel it, 30% == $3 is taken and $7 is refunded

docs.title: Test
docs.text:
For book a test session please kindly refer to this like Book a meeting with shakiba

Info

You can book only one session, more then one will be rejected

docs.title: Classes
docs.text:
For book classes session please kindly refer to this like Book a meeting with shakiba

Info

You can book for two weeks in advanced according to our plan and your payment amount

docs.title: Feedback
docs.text: For book a feedback session please kindly refer to this like [add]

docs.title: Meeting Platform
docs.text: Classes are held on Google Meet, See Links > Meeting

docs.title: Classes' Time
docs.text:
Each session is 30 minutes to ensure effectiveness and manageability by students but it does not mean 60 minutes are not possible, if you are sure you can participate and stay 60 minutes without being tired, we go with 1h class.

Info

One hour English classes for non-native speakers are tiring thus I found reducing classes' time make it better

docs.title: Feedback
docs.text:
At the end of every session you will receive short feedback for that session. Also every two week we will have a feedback session discussing your

  • performance
  • improvement
  • concerns
  • etc

Note

The feedback sessions are optional and free of charge

Info

During any week no non-English speaking is allowed, all the conversation including

  • Texting
  • Chatting
  • Messaging
  • Voicing

will be in English, but if there were something hard to explain or talk about, we will have a conversation at weekends to tackle them.

docs.title: Test
docs.text:
To join a class, a test should be passed to ensure your level is matched with the curriculum.

The time slot for test is 30 minutes. Before the test the payment should be done and after the test was done; if you passed it, the test is considered free and your payment will be refunded to you.

docs.title: Recording Sessions
docs.text: You can record all the sessions we have, or ask me to record them for you.

docs.title: if you record
docs.text:
If you prefer to record, your can use the following google chrome extensions

  1. Screen Recorder io
  2. Screen Recorder
  3. Screen Recorder and Screenshot Tool for Chrome

Tip

I personally use the first one Screen Recorder io

docs.title: if I record
docs.text:
Any type of session we have

  • hr
  • technical
  • mock-interview
  • resume-review
  • etc

You can request to be recorded and the video file (mp4 format) will be available online on class.shakiba.net

Note

Your videos are private and no one has access to

Tip

You can download your videos from class.shakiba.net

docs.title: if I record
docs.text: If I record any session, they will be available privately on class.shakiba.net

docs.title: if your record
docs.text:
It is recommended to record all your real interviews and later share them with me to check and review and give you feedback about.

To share them you can use Google Drive or any other platform you are comfortable with

Warning

If you prefer Google Drive, either you should make your file public or give me (my Gamil account) address, access to, so I can watch/download the file

docs.title: Text to Speech
docs.text:
While there are many audio and video files to see and listen to, but not all great resources are media type. There are many articles and blogs with valuable contents. If you found any valuable text-based resource try to convert them into audio formats like mp3 so you can listen to.

With advances in AI there are websites and online tools to help, here are some of them. These I have tested, no login is needed, and are free

  • Natural Readers
  • speechma

Have not been tested

  • murf.ai/text-to-speech
  • ttsmaker.com
  • play.ht
  • elevenlabs.io

docs.title: Training
docs.text:
Beside interview preparation and practices, we do have training classes. Each subject is a package by itself and we will be learning them. Refer to this package to see more details

The goal is to widen your technical jargon by knowing key concepts and phrases

Note

After each package we will have a mock interview relevant to that package we reviewed

Tip

You can request to add a package if you do not see your desired one here. Please kindly dm on Telegram @shakibamoshiri or link t.me/shakibamoshiri and If you do not have a Telegram account, no problem, email me.

docs.title: Agile
docs.text:
4 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 2h and 30m

  1. Agile Values
  2. Agile Principles
  3. SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle)
  4. Scrum
  5. Mock Technical Interview

docs.title: API
docs.text:
3 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 2h

  1. APIs and REST
  2. API Patterns
  3. API Authentication and Security
  4. Mock Technical interview

docs.title: Database
docs.text:
4 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 2h and 30m

  1. Database Paradigms
  2. Database Choices
  3. Database Scaling
  4. Database Mistakes
  5. Mock Technical Interview

docs.title: DevOps
docs.text:
5 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 3h

  1. VMs-and-containers
  2. CI/CD
  3. CAMS
  4. Deployments
  5. Tools (optional)
  6. Mock Technical Interview

Note

DevOps tools review is optional

docs.title: Distributed System
docs.text:
3 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 2h

  1. Distributed Systems
  2. Cloud Computing
  3. Common Patterns
  4. Mock Technical Interview

docs.title: Networking
docs.text:
6 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 3h and 30m

  1. Network Devices
  2. Network Protocols
  3. The Internet
  4. OSI and TCP/IP model
  5. Network Security
  6. Cybersecurity
  7. Mock Technical Interview

docs.title: Programming Language
docs.text:
2 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 1h and 30m

  1. Programming Languages
  2. Programming Concepts
  3. Mock Technical Interview

docs.title: Software Architecture
docs.text:
4 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 2h and 30m

  1. Software Architecture Patterns
  2. Microservice Patterns
  3. Event-Driven and Event Sourcing
  4. Design Principles
  5. Mock Technical Interview

docs.title: Software Paradigm

  1. Software Paradigms
  2. OOP
  3. Mock Technical Interview

docs.title: Software Principle

1 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 1h

  1. Software Principles
  2. Mock Technical interview

docs.title: Version Control
docs.text:
2 sessions + 1 technical interview, each in 30 minutes, total 1h

  3. Mock Technical interview
